spikes.waveform module¶

spikes.waveform.realign(snip)[source]¶

Realign waveforms to peak

spikes.waveform.realign_special(snip)[source]¶

Realign waveforms to peak, pad out missing values

Full width half maximum

spikes.waveform.getPVT(wf)[source]¶

peak to valley time

spikes.waveform.getWAHP(wf)[source]¶

Width at half peak

spikes.waveform.getPT(wf)[source]¶

Peak-trough duration

spikes.waveform.getPTHW(wf)[source]¶
spikes.waveform.getPHP(wf)[source]¶
spikes.waveform.minmax(wf)[source]¶

Normalize waveform based on extrema

spikes.waveform.normalized_waveform(wf)[source]¶
spikes.waveform.is_thin(wf, thr=0.98, time=123)[source]¶

Determine whether a mean-waveform is a thin spike. Uses amplituce 300 μs post-spike. This procedure was trained on well-isolated cells. See the 20160802_waveform_segmentation notebook for how threshold was derived

spikes.waveform.is_thin_pvt(wf, thr=52.0349055393)[source]¶

Determine whether a mean-waveform is a thin spike. Uses peak-to-valley time

spikes.waveform.process(i_f)[source]¶

Get high-dimensional feature description of data. TODO: remove; how did this even get here?
